trans-unit.source: Contains security-related properties and is attached to a message.

Client authentication results are translated into an instance of <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceSecurityContext>, which is attached to the message using a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityMessageProperty>.
This property can be used by higher layers to implement custom authorization logic.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityMessageProperty"></xref> class.
Clones the current instance of this class.

To access any objects in the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityMessageProperty>, such as <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityMessageProperty.ServiceSecurityContext%2A>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityMessageProperty.TransportToken%2A>, or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityMessageProperty.IncomingSupportingTokens%2A>), a copy must be created because these properties are undefined after the message is disposed of.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IMessageProperty"></xref> cloned from the current instance of this class.
Disposes of the current instance of this class.
Gets or sets a collection of external authorization policies.

By default, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Policy.IAuthorizationPolicy.Evaluate%2A> is called on these authorization policies as part of the process that creates the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceSecurityContext>.
A <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Policy.IAuthorizationPolicy"></xref>.
Gets or creates an instance of this class from the specified message.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message"></xref>.
An instance of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityMessageProperty"></xref>.
Indicates whether the incoming message contains at least one supporting security token.
Supporting tokens provide additional claims beyond those contained in the principal tokens for the binding.
Supporting tokens can be scoped at a different scope than the binding.
`true` if <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityMessageProperty.IncomingSupportingTokens"></xref> contains at least one entry; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a collection of incoming supporting tokens.
Supporting tokens provide additional claims beyond those contained in the principal tokens for the binding.
Supporting tokens can be scoped at a different scope than the binding.
A <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SupportingTokenSpecification"></xref>.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityTokenSpecification"></xref> initiator token for this message.
If the message pattern requires multiple messages, the Initiator Token is used for the message signature from initiator to the recipient, and for encryption from recipient to initiator.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityTokenSpecification"></xref> initiator token for this message.
Gets a collection of outgoing <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SupportingTokenSpecification"></xref> objects.
A collection of outgoing supporting tokens.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityTokenSpecification"></xref> protection token for this message.
Protection Tokens are used in symmetric security bindings for signing and encryption.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityTokenSpecification"></xref> protection token for this message.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityTokenSpecification"></xref> recipient token for this message.
If the message pattern requires multiple messages, the Recipient Token is used for encryption from initiator to recipient, and for the message signature from recipient to initiator.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityTokenSpecification"></xref> recipient token for this message.
Gets or sets the sender ID prefix for this message.
The sender ID prefix for this message.
The property value is `null`.
No character of the property value is alphabetic, numeric, or equal to "_", ".", or "-".
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ServiceSecurityContext"></xref> for this message.
Use this class to obtain information about the runtime security context.
A security context is created when a client is successfully authenticated.
The security information from the client and for the current service instance can be obtained from an instance of this class.
A common use of the class is to retrieve the current set of claims for the purpose of authorizing a client when accessing a method.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ServiceSecurityContext"></xref> object for this message.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityTokenSpecification"></xref> transport token for this message.
A Transport Token provides security at the transport level.
A token used by HTTPS is an example of a Transport Token.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityTokenSpecification"></xref> transport token for this message.
